Description: Fragments of papyrus of Tui containing texts and vignettes from the Book of the Dead
Curator's comments: Other parts of same papyrus: British Museum EA 9913, Bologna KS 3168, Moscow, Pushkin Museum I, 1b, 122.
Bibliographic references: Taylor 2010 / Journey through the afterlife: Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead (no. 155)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (133546) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/133546)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.95-104, p.96, fig.1, p.98, fig.3-4, p.99, fig.5-6, p.100, fig.7, p.103, fig.10)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2010 4th Nov-2011 6th March, Round Reading Room BM, Book of the Dead
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, loss, cockled Black ink Red ink Pigment: loss Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Filmoplast T self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: William Henry Fox Talbot
Acquisition notes: Lot 144 in sale, Christie's, London, 28 April 2009.
